trans-unit.source: Represents a peer located by the "People Near Me" infrastructure.
An instance of this class cannot be created directly.

Instead, a reference to the peers "near" the calling peer is obtained by using the static <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration.GetPeersNearMe%2A> method to return a collection of nearby peers.
A peer represented by a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe> object is not necessarily in the calling peer's address book.
Initializes a new default instance of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> class.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance with the associated parameters required for serialization.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref>.
The serialization destination associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref>.

Generates a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> from the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object and associates it with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.

The Collaboration infrastructure has failed to create and associate a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref>.

Generates a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> with the associated descriptive parameters from the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object and associates it with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref>.
The display name assigned to the newly created contact.
The nickname to assign to the newly created contact.
<xref href="System.Net.Mail.MailAddress"></xref> object that specifies the email address to assign to the newly created contact.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object associated with a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> containing descriptive parameters.

The Collaboration infrastructure has failed to create or update a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref>.
Generates a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object from the provided <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
If the provided <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> does not map to a signed-in peer on the same subnet, `null` is returned.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object that specifies the endpoint associated with the peer.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
The peerEndPoint is `null`.
The referenced <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint.EndPoint"></xref> specifies `null`.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object and optionally releases the managed resources.
Set to `true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Compares the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> to the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance to test for equality.
Returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance provided has matching data, else `false`.
The other argument is `null`.
Compares the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance to the specified object.
The object to test for equality.
Returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance provided has matching data, else `false`.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object has been disposed.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instances are considered equal.
The first <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> to compare.
Returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instances provided have matching data, else `false`.
Returns the hash code for the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code used to compare instances of this type.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object has been disposed.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> with the data required to serialize the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref>.

A derived type must call the base type <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable.GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)"></xref> method.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
The destination for the serialization.
Initiates a network operation to retrieve the application, object and presence data specific to a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance.

The data retrieved is stored in a cache accessed by the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetApplications%2A> and <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetObjects%2A> methods as well as the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerPresenceInfo.PresenceStatus%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.InternalRefreshData%2A> method only needs to be used if the caller is not subscribed to the specified <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer>, <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe>, or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact>.
This method blocks additional calls until the network operation is complete and the cache has been updated.
The caller is not required to sign in with the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration.SignIn%2A> method or via a user interface in to complete this operation successfully.
Specifies the application, object, and presence data relevant to a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance.
Sends an invitation to join a peer collaboration application to a remote peer.

<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse"></xref> object containing the relevant <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponseType"></xref> value specified by the remote peer.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object has been disposed.

The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> specified by the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPointCollection"></xref> is `null` or has a value count of '0' associated endpoints.
A <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> has not been associated with the current peer-to-peer application.
Sends an invitation to join a peer collaboration application to a remote peer that includes data that describes or specifies the application invite.
Specifies the relevant Peer Collaboration application represented by a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> instance.
A message to send to the remote peer along with the application invitation.
The message can be no more than 255 Unicode characters.
A user defined data blob to associate with the invitation.
Size is limited to 16K (16,384 bytes).

<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse"></xref> object containing the relevant <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponseType"></xref> value specified by the remote peer.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object has been disposed.
The applicationToInvite argument specifies `null`.
The applicationToInvite argument specifies an empty .

The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> specified by the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPointCollection"></xref> is `null` or has a value count of '0' associated endpoints.
Receives an invitation response from a peer regarding joining a peer collaboration application.
User-defined object passed to the callback of the asynchronous operation for identification.
This required parameter must be unique across all asynchronous invitation operations still in-progress.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object has been disposed.
The userToken argument specifies `null`.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object does not specify a valid <xref href="System.Guid"></xref>.
Receives an invitation response from a peer regarding an invitation to a peer collaboration application.
Specifies the relevant Peer Collaboration application information represented by a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object.
A message to send to the remote peer along with the application invitation.
The message can be no more than 255 Unicode characters.
A user defined data blob to associate with the invitation.
Size is limited to 16K.
User-defined object passed to the callback of the asynchronous operation for identification.
This required parameter must be unique across all asynchronous invitation operations still in-progress.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object has been disposed.
The applicationToInvite argument specifies `null`.
The userToken argument specifies `null`.
The endpoint specified by <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> was not found.
The applicationToInvite argument specifies an empty .
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.String"></xref> representing the Nickname of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object.
If a contact is generated from a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe> object, the associated contact Nickname is populated with this property value.
<xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the Nickname of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object has been disposed.
Signals the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshDataCompleted"></xref> event.
Classes that inherit from this class can override this method to perform additional tasks when the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshDataCompleted> event occurs.
This method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
Event data contained in a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.RefreshDataCompletedEventArgs"></xref> instance.

Signaled when a new <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance is found, no longer available, or the associated <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object information has changed.
Initiates a network operation to retrieve the application, object and presence data specific to a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance.

The data retrieved is stored in a cache accessed by the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetApplications%2A> and <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetObjects%2A> methods as well as the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerPresenceInfo.PresenceStatus%2A> property.

This method only needs to be used if the caller is not subscribed to the specified <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer>, <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe>, or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact>.
This method blocks additional calls until the network operation is complete and cache has been updated.
The caller is not required to sign in with the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration.SignIn%2A> method or via a user interface in to complete this operation successfully.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object has been disposed.
Initiates a network operation to retrieve the application, object and presence data specific to a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance.

The data retrieved is stored in a cache accessed by the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetApplications%2A> and <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetObjects%2A> methods as well as the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerPresenceInfo.PresenceStatus%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.InternalRefreshData%2A> method only needs to be used if the caller is not subscribed to the specified <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer>, <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe>, or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact>.
This method blocks additional calls until the network operation is complete and cache has been updated.
The caller is not required to sign in with the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration.SignIn%2A> method or via a user interface in to complete this operation successfully.
User-specified state object that is passed to the delegate when this method completes the operation.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object has been disposed.
The userToken argument specifies `null`.
The prior <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshDataAsync(System.Object)"></xref> call has not yet completed.

Signaled when the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData"></xref> or <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshDataAsync(System.Object)"></xref> operation for the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance is completed.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object has been disposed.
Returns <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance.
<xref href="System.String"></xref> representing the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerObject"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object has been disposed.
Populates the current <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance with the data obtained from the serialized source.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
The destination for the serialization.
